name: Pineapple Red Pepper and Cucumber Salad
description: This salad is all about contrasts. In one bite you'll find pineapple, sweet and juicy with a citrus kick, then crisp, clean cucumbers, and a bit of cooling mint. Red peppers add crunch where tomatoes add a mellow sweetness. The dressing continues the theme of salty-sweet: Fish and soy sauces are tempered with sugar and lime juice. I always double the recipe to save some for lunch the next day.
recipeIngredient: 1 large red pepper, cut into 1/4 inch pices

recipeInstructions.text: Make Dressing: In a small bowl, combine fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. Whisk until sugar is dissolved.
Add lime juice, vegetable oil, and garlic clove. Whisk until well combined.
Make Salad: In a large bowl, combine pineapple, cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes.
Pour dressing over salad. Add cilantro and mint and toss to coat.
